verbal trespass warning for all Harvard University property.

Officers dispatched to a report of a disturbance and possible assault in the area. Officers arrived and reported that      Cambridge Police was on scene and had detained an individual actively screaming and resisting arrest. Officers approached  Cambridge Police and reported that CPD had been responding to a possible assault in progress, when the individual was      observed attempting to flee the immediate area and subsequently detained. While on scene, officers were then approached by three juveniles who wished to report a recent assault committed by the individual. According to the three juveniles, the individual had been observed accosting pedestrians while waving a wooden stake in the air inside of Harvard Yard. When the
three juveniles approached the individual regarding their behavior, the individual grabbed one of the juveniles by their  
head and a physical altercation ensued between all parties. According to the three juveniles, during the altercation, the 
individual repeatedly attempted to strike them with the aforementioned wooden stake. One of the juveniles then attempted  
to contact the police when the individual brandished a folded knife, waved it in the air, and stated "I got a knife".     
Shortly thereafter, Cambridge Police arrived on scene and the individual was apprehended after they attempted to flee the 
area. At the conclusion of the incident, the individual was placed under arrest and transported to the Cambridge Police   
Department for booking.

description: Officers dispatched to a report of an individual harassing pedestrians and kicking over property in the area. Officers     arrived and reported that Cambridge Police was on scene and speaking with an individual matching the description of the    person engaged in the harassing and disruptive behavior. Officers then approached Cambridge Police who reported that a     victim was in the immediate area seeking medical attention due to an assault committed by the aforementioned individual.   While at the scene, officers reported that the individual began to engage in increasingly erratic behavior and was         subsequently placed in handcuffs by Cambridge Police. Cambridge Police then reported that a witness to the incident        previously observed the individual in custody throw a glass bottle at the victim's backpack which subsequently broke apart upon impact with the ground. According to the witness, the individual then retrieved a shard of glass from the broken      bottle and lunged towards the victim. Shortly thereafter, the victim arrived to the scene and identified the individual in custody as the person who assaulted them with the glass bottle. The individual was then informed that they were being      placed under arrest and transported to the Harvard University Police Department for booking. While at the Department, the  individual was issued a verbal trespass warning for all Harvard University Property. Officers then performed an inventory  search of the individual's property and discovered several items of drug paraphernalia and a plastic bag containing a      white and clear crystal substance resembling Methamphetamine. Pro Ambulance was then requested and arrived on scene and    the individual was transported to a medical facility for further evaluation.                                                                                                                                                                          Name: Haugh, Francis                                                                                                       Age: 40                                                                                                                    Address: Homeless                                                                                                          Charge(s): Assault and Battery with a Dangerous Weapon (2 Counts)

Officers then approached Cambridge Police who reported that a     victim was in the immediate area seeking medical attention due to an assault committed by the aforementioned individual.   While at the scene, officers reported that the individual began to engage in increasingly erratic behavior and was         subsequently placed in handcuffs by Cambridge Police. Cambridge Police then reported that a witness to the incident        previously observed the individual in custody throw a glass bottle at the victim's backpack which subsequently broke apart upon impact with the ground. According to the witness, the individual then retrieved a shard of glass from the broken      bottle and lunged towards the victim. Shortly thereafter, the victim arrived to the scene and identified the individual in custody as the person who assaulted them with the glass bottle. The individual was then informed that they were being      placed under arrest and transported to the Harvard University Police Department for booking. While at the Department, the  individual was issued a verbal trespass warning for all Harvard University Property. Officers then performed an inventory  search of the individual's property and discovered several items of drug paraphernalia and a plastic bag containing a      white and clear crystal substance resembling Methamphetamine. Pro Ambulance was then requested and arrived on scene and    the individual was transported to a medical facility for further evaluation.                                                                                                                                                                          Name: Haugh, Francis                                                                                                       Age: 40                                                                                                                    Address: Homeless                                                                                                          Charge(s): Assault and Battery with a Dangerous Weapon (2 Counts)

Officer dispatched on the report of an individual that had locked themselves in a bathroom.  Upon arrival the officer     
after trying to get the individual to open the door for several minutes and fearing that the individual could be in       
distress, the officer attempted to make entry into the bathroom.  The officer could not fully open the door as the        
individual was lying on the ground blocking the door.  The officer eventually made entry and observed evidence of drug    
use.  The officer attempted to wake up the individual.  The individual woke up, denied using drugs and immediately tried  
to leave the area.  The officer called for medical assistance but the individual insisted on leaving the area and         
attempted to push by the officer.  The individual was then placed under arrest.
